overview:
## Discussion

This property is a reference to the queue the framework used to create the virtual machine when initialized using [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine/init(configuration:queue:)]. If not specified, the default is the main queue.

The property is accessible from any queue or actor.

Other properties or function calls on [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine] must happen on this queue. The framework also invokes any completion handlers from asynchronous functions on this queue.

The following example shows use of the `VZVirtualMachine.queue` property to check to see if it’s possible to start a VM.

# queue

**Instance Property**

The queue associated with this virtual machine.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated var queue: dispatch_queue_t { get }
```

## Discussion

This property is a reference to the queue the framework used to create the virtual machine when initialized using [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine/init(configuration:queue:)]. If not specified, the default is the main queue.

The property is accessible from any queue or actor.

Other properties or function calls on [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine] must happen on this queue. The framework also invokes any completion handlers from asynchronous functions on this queue.

The following example shows use of the `VZVirtualMachine.queue` property to check to see if it’s possible to start a VM.



## Getting the state of the VM

- **state**: The current execution state of the VM.
- **VZVirtualMachine.State**: The execution states of the VM.
- **graphicsDevices**: The list of configured graphics devices on the virtual machine.
- **canStart**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can start the VM.
- **canPause**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can pause the VM.
- **canResume**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can resume the VM.
- **canStop**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can stop the VM.
- **canRequestStop**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can ask the guest operating system to stop running.
